recipes.title: Chicken nuggets
recipes.author: Sebastian
recipes.description: Learn how to make delicious and crispy chicken nuggets
instructions: Place the chicken chunks into a large zip-top bag. Pour the pickle juice, milk, and hot sauce into the bag and seal. Massage the mixture together and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
Turn your oven onto warm and set aside a large baking sheet.
Using a slotted spoon, remove the chicken nuggets from the oil and place onto the baking sheet. Place the baking sheet in the oven to keep the nuggets warm while you fry the remaining chicken.
notes: Don’t transfer the chicken onto a paper towel to absorb oil. This creates soggy bottomed nuggets. Just drain the oil using a slotted spoon. Store airtight in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

recipes.title: Pasta with olive oil and garlic
recipes.author: Diana
recipes.description: This pasta recipe is a simple Italian classic you'll find in trattorias all across Italy
instructions: Cook 1lb/500g of dried spaghetti (or any other long dried pasta) in a large pot of salted boiling water per packet minus 1 minute.
Add pasta into chosen sauce with 3/4 cup pasta cooking water. Toss pasta until sauce thickens and sticks to pasta, 1 - 2 minutes. Use more pasta water if needed to loosen sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Finish pasta per chosen recipe.
notes: Canned tomatoes - not all canned tomatoes are created equal. Good quality ones are naturally sweet with better tomato flavour, poor quality ones are sour and often unripe tomatoes. If needed, add sugar to sweeten tomatoes.

recipes.title: Homemade pizza
recipes.author: Henry
recipes.description: This is a classic homemade pizza recipe. Make perfect pizza at home!
instructions: Mix the dough ingredients together by hand or use a hand-held or stand mixer.
Place dough into a greased mixing bowl, cover tightly, and set aside to rise for about 90 minutes or overnight in the refrigerator.
Bake pizza at a very high temperature for only about 15 minutes.
notes: Working with pizza dough is easiest if it’s at room temperature. If the dough is frozen, defrost it in the refrigerator before bringing it to room temperature.

recipes.title: Ground beef tacos
recipes.author: Yolanda
recipes.description: Our favorite seasoned ground beef for tacos is here! This is what I prep on super busy weeknights – and I even prep it ahead of time too. In 15 minutes this seasoned beef will be done and you’ll want to eat a taco or nacho every single night.
instructions: Cook the ground beef, cook it up until it’s completely browned. Drain the  grease. Then when we return to the heat to the stove lower the heat, add the  homemade taco seasoning and a small amount of tomato sauce.
Allow the taco meat to simmer briefly in the sauce to give more flavor.
Fry the corn tortillas in a small amount of oil in a medium size skillet. Once fried  on both sides, remove the tortillas and fold in half to form their shape.
Fill the taco shells with the cooked beef and any toppings desired.
notes: Plan on using 1 lb of meat for 4 people. This will yield about 2-3 tablespoons of meat per taco.
